entry.title: Replying to @okayy.letsgo this is such an important distinction to make, thanks for bringing it up! gender *identity* is something that exists within ourselves. across history and cultures we consistently see broad concepts of "man", "woman" and "other/s"
entry.content: Replying to @okayy.letsgo this is such an important distinction to make, thanks for bringing it up! gender *identity* is something that exists within ourselves. across history and cultures we consistently see broad concepts of "man", "woman" and "other/s". what those words are, what the roles and presentation are expected changes across time and culture and location. #gender #trans #enby #nonbinary #education #butch #lesbian #lgbt

entry.title: Replying to @mickey_lou I wasn't born in the wrong body, all of me is trans. I love my trans body. I love that I can grow a beard and grow a baby. I have been able to access care to help me feel really good in my body - something all trans people (and ev
entry.content: Replying to @mickey_lou I wasn't born in the wrong body, all of me is trans. I love my trans body. I love that I can grow a beard and grow a baby. I have been able to access care to help me feel really good in my body - something all trans people (and everyone) deserves. âœ¨all trans people's experiences are different and I support anyone who does find the language of being born in the wrong body helpful âœ¨ #trans #body #pregnancy #transeducation #lgbtq

entry.title: Replying to @sannevdv283 we conflate pregnancy and femininity, when so many women experience their femininity in different ways and at different times in their life. if your experience of pregnancy was the most feminine you've ever felt, that's an amazin
entry.content: Replying to @sannevdv283 we conflate pregnancy and femininity, when so many women experience their femininity in different ways and at different times in their life. if your experience of pregnancy was the most feminine you've ever felt, that's an amazing part of your story and identity. for me and many others that isn't the case. as for me, my body isn't the wrong one and it also isn't a woman's. my body is incredibly trans and I feel so lucky to get to have made life with it. #trans #pregnancy #feminine #masculine #gender #lgbt #ally

entry.title: Replying to @joborn1977 in forgetting that trans men and trans masculine people exist, transphobes are literally opening the door to cis men being in women's spaces. not to mention making it intensely unsafe for anyone, cis or trans, who is gender noncon
entry.content: Replying to @joborn1977 in forgetting that trans men and trans masculine people exist, transphobes are literally opening the door to cis men being in women's spaces. not to mention making it intensely unsafe for anyone, cis or trans, who is gender nonconforming in their presentation. #trans #lgbt #lgbtq #queer #enby #toilets

entry.title: Replying to @janedo133 having babies is a blessing, but so is the choice and freedom to be able to transition. to have a body that I feel comfortable in and people around me who use the words that are right for me and for my body. everyone deserves that.
entry.content: Replying to @janedo133 having babies is a blessing, but so is the choice and freedom to be able to transition. to have a body that I feel comfortable in and people around me who use the words that are right for me and for my body. everyone deserves that. #trans #identity #lgbt #lgbtq #queer
